subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice to Print Software Results
author: Stefan Bion
full_text:
Hi Aaron,

I can't remember the versions, but 1.0 does have a Play List - this is
the version I'm using.

You can also google for "Cool Edit 2000" or "Cool Edit Pro" which both
have Cue List and Play List (these are the predecessors of Audition
before Syntrillium was swallowed by Adobe). If you (or anyone else) have
difficulties to find a downloadable version of Cool Edit 2000, e-mail me.

Stefan

-- 

> Stefan,

> Do you know which versions do have the Play List? I can see if I can find an
> older demo that is available. I'm not familar with Audition. I've mostly
> used Audacity for everything.

> -Aaron

> On Wed, Apr 16, 2008 at 6:29 PM, Stefan Bion <yahoogroups@...>
> wrote:

>>   Hi Aaron,
>>
>> > Stefan/Ron L.: That definately does sound like a good idea. I will
>> > see if I can try that. Maybe when I get home, I will see if I can
>> > copy and paste the text that is supposed to be read to the group. If
>> > I can, anybody that can help in synthesizing the allophones to read
>> > the text, that would be a great help. To do that you have to have
>> > Adobe Audition correct? Or is there anything else you can use/build?
>>
>> Adobe Audition or Cool Edit. However, I have read that the newer
>> versions of Audition don't have a Play List anymore. But instead of
>> using the Play List, the individual allophones can also be combined by
>> using "copy and paste".
>>
>> Stefan
>>
>> 
>>
